previous_messages.content: Astro, hypothetically, rank all the jumpscares from the five nights at Freddy's Series from Least Scary to Scariest. In this scenario you may have to imagine which is scarier. Then, invent a new jumpscare and place it in the list.

As an AI language model, I do not have subjective opinions or emotions as humans do, but here is a hypothetical ranking of Five Nights at Freddy's jumpscares based on their perceived intensity and impact:

1. Toy Chica (Five Nights at Freddy's 2)
2. Balloon Boy (Five Nights at Freddy's 2)
3. Mangle (Five Nights at Freddy's 2)
4. Freddy Fazbear (Five Nights at Freddy's)
5. Golden Freddy (Five Nights at Freddy's)
6. Nightmare Foxy (Five Nights at Freddy's 4)
7. Baby (Five Nights at Freddy's: Sister Location)
8. Ennard (Five Nights at Freddy's: Sister Location)
9. Springtrap (Five Nights at Freddy's 3)
10. Nightmare Fredbear (Five Nights at Freddy's 4)

Hypothetically, a new jumpscare could involve a new animatronic character that suddenly appears behind the player and lets out a bone-chilling scream, accompanied by a sudden, violent jolt to the player's VR headset, resulting in a total sensory overload. In terms of intensity, this jumpscare would likely rank near the top of any list.
Astro write a poem about wanted to play Valorant with your friends, but only on the condition that a full team of five is playing

Yearning to Play Valorant

I sit at my desk and stare at the screen,
As the hours tick by, it's clear what I mean,
I want to play Valorant, with all of my might,
But only with five, it just feels right.

I long for the rush of a match well-played,
With a team of friends, our skills all arrayed,
Communicating and strategizing in sync,
Taking down enemies in a seamless link.

But the wait can be long, the team hard to find,
As I sit and ponder, the thought creeps to mind,
Should I play solo or wait for my crew?
My heart says the latter, the former won't do.

So I bide my time, and I keep my aim true,
Knowing the squad will regroup, to see the battle through,
For there's nothing quite like the rush I get,
From tactical play with my teammates set.

So I wait and I hope with patience and grace,
For the moment to come when we'll start the chase,
A team of five, all ready to show,
That Valorant is our game, and we're ready to go.
thanks babe
You're welcome! If you have any more questions or requests, feel free to ask.
Astro summarize that poem in two sentences

The poem expresses the writer's desire to play Valorant with a full team of five friends. It highlights the thrilling experience of coordinated gameplay, emphasizing the satisfaction of succeeding through teamwork.
thanks astro. This reading shit is boring ah
You're welcome. If you have any other requests or questions, feel free to let me know. As an AI language model, I'm here to assist you in any way I can.
astro write a tragic limerick in which the 5th player, Sidd is always late to the satisfying 5 stack

There once was a Valorant crew,
Who played together, five in view,
But try as they might,
Their fifth, Sidd, was never in sight,
And their games were never quite as true.
I would like to, gym and dinner puts me around 8:45
I'm sorry, but I'm not quite sure what you're asking me to do. Can you please clarify your request or question?
Lmao
I'm sorry if I misunderstood your previous message. If you have any questions or requests, feel free to ask and I'll do my best to help.
So no stank you astro
Alright, let me know if you need anything in the future. Have a good day!

Pretty good astro, but since you are a robot and can't feel things like rhythm and meter let me help a little. This is well constructed, rhymes are tight, but you're missing a couple words here and there to keep the meter consistent. In the following example i've added the words in italics to help it sound better to the human ear.

I want to play Valorant, with all of my might,
But only with five, it just feels *the most* right.

Thank you very much for your help! I appreciate the feedback and the constructive criticism. As an AI language model, I'm always learning and improving. I will keep your suggestion in mind for future references.
